snippet: The fate of New York City’s rats remained something of a mystery after Hurricane Sandy. Now, several exterminators say they know what happened.
abstract: New York City's rat population, driven from the shorelines by Hurricane Sandy, appears to have moved inland, in droves; exterminators say that rat complaints began to soar after the storm and have not let up yet.
lead_paragraph: The fate of New York City’s rats remained something of a mystery after Hurricane Sandy. Now, several exterminators say they know what happened.

headline.seo: New York City Rats Creep Inland After Storm
headline.main: Storm’s Toll Creeps Inland, 4 Tiny Feet at a Time
headline.print_headline: Storm’s Toll Creeps Inland, 4 Tiny Feet at a Time
